references.title: QCFAIL
references.summary: Articles about common next-generation sequencing problems

references.title: A quality control system for profiles obtained by ChIP sequencing
references.summary: Presents an approach that associates global and local QC indicators to ChIP-seq data sets as well as to a variety of enrichment-based studies by NGS.

references.title: A survey of best practices for RNA-seq data analysis
references.summary: Highlights the challenges associated with each step of RNA-seq data analysis.

references.title: Summarizing and correcting the GC content bias in high-throughput sequencing
references.summary: Summarizes the many possible sourced of GC bias for deeply sequenced samples.

references.title: Sequencing depth and coverage: key considerations in genomic analyses
references.summary: Discuss the issue of sequencing depth in the design of next-generation sequencing experiments.

references.title: Quality assessment and control of high-throughput sequencing data
references.summary: Collection of papers on quality controls for various NGS applications

references.title: Identification and correction of systematic error in high-throughput sequence data
references.summary: Reviews and proposes correction for systematic base pair errors in deep sequencing

references.title: Heat seq: an interactive web tool for high-throughput sequencing experiment comparison with public data
references.summary: Presents a web-tool that allows genome scale comparison of high throughput experiments

references.title: Genome evolution and meiotic maps by massively parallel DNA sequencing
Stacks: building and genotyping loci de novo from short-read sequences
Genome-wide genetic marker discovery and genotyping using next-generation sequencing
SNP Discovery and Genotyping for Evolutionary Genetics using RAD sequencing
Applications of next generation sequencing in molecular ecology of non-model organisms
Population genomics of parallel adaptation in threespine stickleback using sequenced RAD tags

references.authors: Gompert, Z., and C. A. Buerkle. 2011a
references.title: A hierarchical Bayesian model for next-generation population genomics

references.authors: Gompert, Z., and C. A. Buerkle. 2011b
references.title: Bayesian estimation of genomic clines
Estimation of allele frequencies from high-coverage genome-sequencing projects
Genomic scans for selective sweeps using SNP data
Using population genomics to detect selection in natural populations: Key concepts and methodological considerations
Adaptation genomics: the next generation
An SNP map of the human genome generated by reduced representation shotgun sequencing
Linkage mapping and comparative genomics using next-generation RAD sequencing of a non-model organism
Construction and application for QTL analysis of a Restriction Site Associated DNA (RAD) linkage map in barley
A first-generation haplotype map of maize
Rapid SNP discovery and genetic mapping using sequenced RAD markers
Resolving postglacial phylogeography using high-throughput sequencing
Local De Novo Assembly of RAD Paired-End Contigs Using Short Sequencing Reads
Next-generation RAD sequencing identifies thousands of SNPs for assessing hybridization between rainbow and westslope cutthroat trout
Rapid and cost-effective polymorphism identification and genotyping using restriction site associated DNA (RAD) markers
Paired-end RAD-seq for de novo assembly and marker design without available reference
Multiplexed shotgun genotyping for rapid and efficient genetic mapping
A Robust, Simple Genotyping-by-Sequencing (GBS) Approach for High Diversity Species
High-Throughput Detection of Induced Mutations and Natural Variation Using KeyPoint™ Technology

references.authors: van Orsouw, N. J., et al. 2007
references.title: Complexity reduction of polymorphic sequences (CRoPS): a novel approach for large-scale polymorphism discovery in complex genomes

references.authors: van Tassell, C. P., et al. 2008
references.title: SNP discovery and allele frequency estimation by deep sequencing of reduced representation libraries
The power and promise of population genomics: from genotyping to genome typing
Genotype and SNP calling from next-generation sequencing data

materials.title: Quality Control
questions: How to perform quality control of NGS raw data?
What are the quality parameters to check for a dataset?
How to improve the quality of a dataset?
objectives: Assess short reads FASTQ quality using FASTQE 🧬😎 and FastQC
Assess long reads FASTQ quality using Nanoplot and PycoQC
Perform quality correction with Cutadapt (short reads)
key_points: Perform quality control on every dataset before running any other bioinformatics analysis
Assess the quality metrics and improve quality if necessary
Check the impact of the quality control
Different tools are available to provide additional quality metrics
For paired-end reads analyze the forward and reverse reads together

contributors.name: Erasmus+ Programme
contributors.funding_statement: This project (2020-1-NL01-KA203-064717) is funded with the support of the Erasmus+ programme of the European Union. Their funding has supported a large number of tutorials within the GTN across a wide array of topics.

tutorial.description: In this tutorial you will get some hand-on experience performing a quality assessment on sequencing data.
tutorial.title: Quality Control

slides.description: This lecture goes over the concepts involved in assessing the quality of your sequencing data.
slides.title: Quality Control

session.title: Quality Control
session.description: In this sesssion, we will walk you through the basics of quality checking your sequencing data. This session consists of a lecture followed by a hands-on tutorial.

data.inputs:
---
reads_1:
  class: File
  location: https://zenodo.org/record/61771/files/GSM461178_untreat_paired_subset_1.fastq
reads_2:
  class: File
  location: https://zenodo.org/record/61771/files/GSM461178_untreat_paired_subset_2.fastq

jobs.command_line: ln -s '/data/dnb08/galaxy_db/files/3/8/3/dataset_3835c7cb-1707-4e6f-85d2-6f1ad5c31bc4.dat' 'GSM461178_untreat_paired_subset_1_fastq' && mkdir -p '/data/jwd01/main/060/059/60059402/working/dataset_a0107efb-9924-481b-99eb-5e7c74c4c697_files' && fastqc --outdir '/data/jwd01/main/060/059/60059402/working/dataset_a0107efb-9924-481b-99eb-5e7c74c4c697_files'    --quiet --extract  --kmers 7 -f 'fastq' 'GSM461178_untreat_paired_subset_1_fastq'  && cp '/data/jwd01/main/060/059/60059402/working/dataset_a0107efb-9924-481b-99eb-5e7c74c4c697_files'/*/fastqc_data.txt output.txt && cp '/data/jwd01/main/060/059/60059402/working/dataset_a0107efb-9924-481b-99eb-5e7c74c4c697_files'/*\.html output.html

params.output_options: {"info_file": false, "report": true, "rest_file": false, "too_long_file": false, "too_short_file": false, "untrimmed_file": false, "wildcard_file": false}

jobs.command_line: ln -s '/data/dnb08/galaxy_db/files/9/9/6/dataset_9968668a-3051-4e02-aa3d-4997838a0985.dat' 'GSM461178_untreat_paired_subset_2_fastq' && mkdir -p '/data/jwd05e/main/060/059/60059404/working/dataset_3bc9888e-ec3f-4ae0-b61c-db19dec8e43e_files' && fastqc --outdir '/data/jwd05e/main/060/059/60059404/working/dataset_3bc9888e-ec3f-4ae0-b61c-db19dec8e43e_files'    --quiet --extract  --kmers 7 -f 'fastq' 'GSM461178_untreat_paired_subset_2_fastq'  && cp '/data/jwd05e/main/060/059/60059404/working/dataset_3bc9888e-ec3f-4ae0-b61c-db19dec8e43e_files'/*/fastqc_data.txt output.txt && cp '/data/jwd05e/main/060/059/60059404/working/dataset_3bc9888e-ec3f-4ae0-b61c-db19dec8e43e_files'/*\.html output.html

params.output_options: {"info_file": false, "report": true, "rest_file": false, "too_long_file": false, "too_short_file": false, "untrimmed_file": false, "wildcard_file": false}

jobs.command_line: die() { echo "$@" 1>&2 ; exit 1; } &&  mkdir multiqc_WDir &&   mkdir multiqc_WDir/fastqc_0 &&    mkdir 'multiqc_WDir/fastqc_0/data_0' &&  mkdir 'multiqc_WDir/fastqc_0/data_0/file_0' && ln -s '/data/dnb08/galaxy_db/files/8/a/a/dataset_8aadb0d6-4752-43b3-9a70-b58359fe1659.dat' 'multiqc_WDir/fastqc_0/data_0/file_0/fastqc_data.txt' && mkdir 'multiqc_WDir/fastqc_0/data_0/file_1' && ln -s '/data/dnb08/galaxy_db/files/e/d/e/dataset_edecc2ea-fa52-4947-9c41-f5956870688a.dat' 'multiqc_WDir/fastqc_0/data_0/file_1/fastqc_data.txt' &&  multiqc multiqc_WDir --filename "report"

materials.admin_install_yaml:
---
install_tool_dependencies: true
install_repository_dependencies: true
install_resolver_dependencies: true
tools:
- name: fastqc
  owner: devteam
  revisions: e7b2202befea
  tool_panel_section_label: Sequence analysis
  tool_shed_url: https://toolshed.g2.bx.psu.edu/
- name: fastqc
  owner: devteam
  revisions: 3d0c7bdf12f5
  tool_panel_section_label: Sequence analysis
  tool_shed_url: https://toolshed.g2.bx.psu.edu/
- name: fastqe
  owner: iuc
  revisions: 89d299153577
  tool_panel_section_label: Sequence analysis
  tool_shed_url: https://toolshed.g2.bx.psu.edu/
- name: multiqc
  owner: iuc
  revisions: 75c93c70d094
  tool_panel_section_label: Sequence analysis
  tool_shed_url: https://toolshed.g2.bx.psu.edu/
- name: nanoplot
  owner: iuc
  revisions: 0f1c34698076
  tool_panel_section_label: Sequence analysis
  tool_shed_url: https://toolshed.g2.bx.psu.edu/
- name: pycoqc
  owner: iuc
  revisions: dc1500f42073
  tool_panel_section_label: Sequence analysis
  tool_shed_url: https://toolshed.g2.bx.psu.edu/
- name: cutadapt
  owner: lparsons
  revisions: 660cffd8d92a
  tool_panel_section_label: Sequence analysis
  tool_shed_url: https://toolshed.g2.bx.psu.edu/
- name: cutadapt
  owner: lparsons
  revisions: 44e2cc14f75b
  tool_panel_section_label: Sequence analysis
  tool_shed_url: https://toolshed.g2.bx.psu.edu/

materials.title: Mapping
questions: What two things are crucial for a correct mapping?
objectives: You will learn what mapping is
A genome browser is shown that helps you to understand your data
key_points: There are many mapping algorithms, it depends on your data which one to choose

tutorial.description: In this tutorial you will map sequencing data to a reference genome, and explore the mapped reads in a genome browser.
tutorial.title: Mapping

slides.description: This lecture covers the basic concepts involved in mapping sequencing reads to a reference genome.
slides.title: Mapping

session.title: Mapping
session.description: In this sesssion, we will walk you through the basics of mapping your sequencing data to a reference genome. This session consists of a lecture followed by a hands-on tutorial.

data.inputs:
---
reads_1:
  class: File
  location: https://zenodo.org/record/1324070/files/wt_H3K4me3_read1.fastq.gz
reads_2:
  class: File
  location: https://zenodo.org/record/1324070/files/wt_H3K4me3_read2.fastq.gz

jobs.command_line: ln -s '/data/dnb08/galaxy_db/files/6/8/9/dataset_689bd625-8e53-484d-a369-e8f88e298ae8.dat' 'wt_H3K4me3_read1_fastq_gz.gz' && mkdir -p '/data/jwd05e/main/060/058/60058034/working/dataset_efc9b134-bbc0-4a68-9655-0ee02cf880af_files' && fastqc --outdir '/data/jwd05e/main/060/058/60058034/working/dataset_efc9b134-bbc0-4a68-9655-0ee02cf880af_files'    --quiet --extract  --kmers 7 -f 'fastq' 'wt_H3K4me3_read1_fastq_gz.gz'  && cp '/data/jwd05e/main/060/058/60058034/working/dataset_efc9b134-bbc0-4a68-9655-0ee02cf880af_files'/*/fastqc_data.txt output.txt && cp '/data/jwd05e/main/060/058/60058034/working/dataset_efc9b134-bbc0-4a68-9655-0ee02cf880af_files'/*\.html output.html

ln -s '/data/dnb08/galaxy_db/files/6/5/4/dataset_654f0d1a-35d6-4c17-863b-1ed725a10d3c.dat' 'wt_H3K4me3_read2_fastq_gz.gz' && mkdir -p '/data/jwd02f/main/060/058/60058035/working/dataset_5f25fcad-3405-4aa3-a343-8eb710d98761_files' && fastqc --outdir '/data/jwd02f/main/060/058/60058035/working/dataset_5f25fcad-3405-4aa3-a343-8eb710d98761_files'    --quiet --extract  --kmers 7 -f 'fastq' 'wt_H3K4me3_read2_fastq_gz.gz'  && cp '/data/jwd02f/main/060/058/60058035/working/dataset_5f25fcad-3405-4aa3-a343-8eb710d98761_files'/*/fastqc_data.txt output.txt && cp '/data/jwd02f/main/060/058/60058035/working/dataset_5f25fcad-3405-4aa3-a343-8eb710d98761_files'/*\.html output.html

ln -s '/data/dnb08/galaxy_db/files/6/8/9/dataset_689bd625-8e53-484d-a369-e8f88e298ae8.dat' input_1.fastq.gz &&  ln -s '/data/dnb08/galaxy_db/files/6/5/4/dataset_654f0d1a-35d6-4c17-863b-1ed725a10d3c.dat' input_2.fastq.gz &&  trim_galore  --phred33    --output_dir ./      --paired      input_1.fastq.gz input_2.fastq.gz   && if [ -f input_1_trimmed.fq.gz ] ; then mv input_1_trimmed.fq.gz input_1_trimmed.fq ; fi && if [ -f input_1_val_1.fq.gz ] ; then mv input_1_val_1.fq.gz input_1_val_1.fq ; fi && if [ -f input_2_val_2.fq.gz ] ; then mv input_2_val_2.fq.gz input_2_val_2.fq ; fi && if [ -f input_1_unpaired_1.fq.gz ] ; then mv input_1_unpaired_1.fq.gz input_1_unpaired_1.fq ; fi && if [ -f input_2_unpaired_2.fq.gz ] ; then mv input_2_unpaired_2.fq.gz input_2_unpaired_2.fq ; fi

materials.title: Removal of human reads from SARS-CoV-2 sequencing data
questions: How can you remove traces of human sequence data from a sequenced viral sample?
objectives: Obtain viral (SARS-CoV-2) sequencing data with contaminating human reads from public sources
Organize the data into a collection
Preprocess and map the data against the human reference genome
Eliminate reads/read pairs that map to the human genome from the original data
key_points: Before submitting raw viral sequencing data to public databases you will want to remove human sequence traces
Human reads can be identified by mapping the data to the human reference genome
After mapping, you can extract the read identifiers of the non-human reads and use these to extract just the desired original sequenced reads from the input data

materials.title: Removal of human reads from SARS-CoV-2 sequencing data

both.title: Removal of human reads from SARS-CoV-2 sequencing data

materials.title: NCBI BLAST+ against the MAdLand
questions: How can we perform Blast analysis on Galaxy?
key_points: Blast tool searches a database of sequences for similar sequences to a query sequence.
Diamond  quickly aligns large-scale data sets using a compressed version of the reference sequences called a "database diamond".
MAdLand is a database of fully sequenced plant and algal genomes, with an emphasis on non-seed plants and streptophyte algae that can be use for sequence similarity search.

materials.title: SARS-CoV-2 Viral Sample Alignment and Variant Visualization
questions: How do I check my data quality?
How do I put together my dataset of fragmented sequences into a full sequence?
How do I visually explore the variants in my SARS-CoV-2 sample?
objectives: Gather and evaluate experimental evidence, including qualitative and quantitative data
Generate and interpret graphs displaying experimental results
Critique large data sets and use bioinformatics to assess genetics data
Tap into the interdisciplinary nature of science
key_points: Use Galaxy on the AnVIL cloud computing resource to check data, perform an alignment, and visualize the results.
